field.name: summary
field.value: DP2 does not appear to ChangeInvocationTarget correctly

field.name: description
field.value: DP2 does not correctly assign the channel created by the delegate within the WcfManagedChannelInterceptor.EnsureOpenChannel method once the service has been stopped and restarted; afterwards the ChannelCredentialsInterceptor always receives a closed channel.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
DP works just fine.
Proxy target does not get changed, because this line: if (channel != null && !WcfUtils.IsCommunicationObjectReady(channel)) evaluates to false.
And please, learn how to create tests. You must be joking if you're expecting me to install some custom certificate.

comment.author: cneuwirt
comment.text: I am not sure anything can be done about this. The issue is that once the service is disconnected, WCF doesn't seem to know about it until a request is made, which is too late at that point.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: We may add something like IRecreationPolicy try invoke an operation. If we get faulted proxy exception, ask IRecreationPolicy if we should recrete proxy and retry invoking the operation and act accordingly to the answer.

comment.author: cneuwirt
comment.text:
Krzysztof,
I believe the proxy is not yet in a faulted state. Once the invocation is performed, it becomes faulted. If I recreate the proxy, how can I retry the current invocation since it has already completed? Are you thinking I should create a new call internally?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
If we do it that way, then yes, we should resend messages that we're positive weren't received.
However this is slippery slope on its own, for example we can't say if a oneway message was received or not, unless we use certain bindings.
I think there should be some facility to support this, but due to broken WCF behavior I'm not sure how to implement it, and to what extent.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: First of all this is not a DP issue. Second, this is how WCF works, and we can't really do much about it.

comment.author: cneuwirt
comment.text: This will now work with trunk if you add the ChannelReconnectPolicy to the container or endpoint.
